These steeds stand upon puffs of air, their grassy manes and tails swishing majestically in the wind. When they are not participating in a hunt, wild hunt horses enjoy constructing complicated courses through land and sky and racing each other for ever-changing stakes. **[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Wild Hunt Horse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2213) **Source** [Kingmaker Adventure Path](/Sources.aspx?ID=150) pg. 617 **Perception** +29; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), greensight, [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 30 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); [_speak with animals_](/Spells.aspx?ID=293), [_speak with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +27, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +31, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +29 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +6 **Int** -1 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +4 **Greensight** The wild hunt horse ignores the [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) condition from leaves and other foliage.
**Planar Acclimation** The wild hunt horse treats the plane it is located on as its home plane.
**Wild Hunt Link** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)) 500 feet. A wild hunt horse grants all other members of the [wild hunt](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=323) in the aura except wild hunt horses a +10-foot status bonus to Speed. --- **AC** 37 **Fort** +27 **Ref** +23 **Will** +29 **HP** 320 **Weaknesses** [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 15 **[Buck](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=6)** DC 36
**Instinctive Cooperation** The wild hunt horse automatically achieves a critical success on saving throws against effects created by other allied wild hunt creatures.
**Rider Synergy** If the wild hunt horse has a wild hunt rider, damage done to the horse or rider from Strikes is split equally between the two.
**Wild Gaze** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) 30 feet. Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt horse come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must succeed at a DC 31 Will save to resist becoming [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) (slowed 2 on a critical failure). The wild hunt horse can deactivate or activate this aura by using a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait. --- **Speed** 80 feet, fly 80 feet **Melee** hoof +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 3d10+12 bludgeoning plus 1d8 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) **Primal Innate Spells** DC 36 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Know Direction](/Spells.aspx?ID=169), [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177) - **6th** [Stone Tell](/Spells.aspx?ID=310) - **8th** [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128), [Tree Stride](/Spells.aspx?ID=343) (self plus willing rider) - **Constant (8th)** [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293), [Speak with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=294) **Bewildering Hoofbeats** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The wild hunt horse stamps its hooves and prances in place, creating the sound of hundreds of horses apparently approaching from all directions. Each creature within 60 feet must attempt a DC 33 Will save.
**Critical Success** The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Bewildering Hoofbeats for 1 hour.
**Success** The creature is distracted by the sound. Until the start of the creature's next turn, if it attempts to use a reaction, it must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or the reaction is disrupted, wasted with no effect.
**Failure** The creature is bewildered by the sound, with the same effects as success except it is also [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the confusion effect persists for 1 minute or until the creature recovers by other means. **Deafening Cry** ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)) The wild hunt horse gives out a thundering cry in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area take 16d6 sonic damage (DC 36 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save, plus deafened for 1 minute on a critical failure). The wild hunt horse can't use Deafening Cry again for 1d4 rounds. **Focus Gaze** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The wild hunt horse fixes its glare at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the wild hunt horse's wild gaze. If the creature was already [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) by the wild gaze before attempting its save, a failed save causes it to be [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round. After attempting its save, the creature is temporarily immune to Focus Gaze from any wild hunt until the start of the wild hunt horse's next turn. **[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 36.
